name: Elephant District
address: 9 Old Fulton St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA

reviews.text: Good Thai restaurant
love the food! Owner was so nice! Made me so nostalgic since Iâ€™m from Thailand
Amazing food, and great service from our server Kay!

If you're looking for truly authentic Thai cuisine, Ã©lÃ©phant district is an absolute gem. The atmosphere feels more like a lively canteen than a styled restaurant â€” and thatâ€™s exactly what makes it so real. It instantly brought me back to my days in Thailand: the simplicity, the energy, the feeling of everyday life and everyday food done beautifully.

From the moment we arrived, Peter welcomed us with genuine warmth, making us feel right at home. And a special thank you to Kay, who took attentive and thoughtful care of us throughout the meal. She was friendly, present, and knowledgeable without ever overwhelming the experience.

The food itself is outstanding â€” bold, fresh, and deeply flavorful. Every dish tastes like itâ€™s made with care and authenticity, not adjusted or toned down. And itâ€™s always a good sign when many Thai guests choose to eat there too â€” it says a lot about how true the flavors are.

Iâ€™ve enjoyed Thai food in many different places, and this is truly among the most memorable experiences. If youâ€™re craving genuine Thai flavors and an atmosphere that transports you right back to Thailand, this place is a must. We will absolutely be returning.
Wow! awesome food and service. The atmosphere is fantastic. the crab meat fried rice 100% recommend 10 of 10.
The food was fantastic and came quick. Kay was wonderful and very sweet and attentive. Excited to come back and try again.

It was a nice comfortable place to have good thai food. It was Vickyâ€™s first day at work, and she was so sweet. Took good care of us.
I recommend this place after a good walk on Brooklyn Bridge

We had a wonderful family dinner at Elephant District, and everything was spot on â€” from the vibrant Thai flavors to the cozy, welcoming atmosphere. Each dish was beautifully presented and bursting with authentic taste.

Special mention to Kay, who gave us truly outstanding service â€” warm, attentive, and made us feel right at home. Itâ€™s rare to find a place that combines great food, friendly service, and such a relaxed vibe so perfectly.

Highly recommended for anyone looking for delicious Thai cuisine in Brooklyn â€” weâ€™ll definitely be back!

Vicky is the best!
Food is so good! The best pad thai!
Food is the best! Our sever Vicky gave us 5 star treatment! Highly recommended!
Food was fantastic! Loved the pad thai and tom yum soup. Would love to go back. Good service from Vicki :)
vicki our server is superbâ€¦ shes very accomodating

First time at this restaurant and the food was amazing 10/10. I ordered the crab fried rice and the bangkok fried wings, everything was super delicious. & the waitress Vicky helped us with picking our entree. She was a great hostess ! We sat outside and it was a nice ambience, dog friendly with the outdoor seating. Ordered the elephant drink but it doesnâ€™t come in the glass if you sit outside so just be mindful of that and I recommend ordering with less ice. But other than that this place is a 4.5/5

Had a fantastic birthday at Elephant District with Kay serving us. Came in for my birthday and was taken care of with extreme care and great service. Food was delicious, service was fast, and they even accommodated a birthday cake for us.
Vicky was so amazing great waitress
excellent and flavorful food! great service and cocktails!
Incredible all the way around.
Vicki was wonderful! Great service, great food.
Small and intimate environment but the flavors of the food really burst through. Comforting duck meal in the chilly fall. Vicky provided such great service.

Absolutely loved the ambiance and food of this place! Easily some of the best pad thai and mango sticky rice Ive ever had. Also had amazing service (our waitress, Ricki, was super attentive and kind!).
Great place with good food
Amazing and delicious food
Kay was great! Duck coconut curry is a must! Make sure to come with plenty of space to eat, servings are huge
I Had a great time here with my family about a month ago and our server City was so fun and nice. She truly made our experience here worth it.
Amazing Thai food in town. Especially Loving Mango Sticky rice
The food was great as always, and Kay did a great job with service. Love this place!!

Iâ€™m a bit upset to only have discovered this gem in my neighborhood a year after it opened. I love Thai cuisine and this establishment hit it out of the park. Delicious food, nice atmosphere, and attentive service made it a â€œmust come back againâ€ place for us.
So good and flavorful! Presentation is beautiful.

Just went to this gem thai food in dumbo and wow, absolutely loved it! ğŸ˜ The food was incredible pad thai and wings wowww (honestly one of the best thai meals Iâ€™ve had in Brooklyn), and Kay was amazing! So kind, attentive, and made the whole experience even better. Canâ€™t wait to come back soon, Iâ€™m officially obsessed! ğŸ’›ğŸ¥¢ Highly recommend! ğŸ”¥
Best Thai place in the neighborhood! I had the panang curry with crispy tofu and it was very flavorful with just the right amount of spice. K helped us and she was so warm!
Great service and amazing food
Food was delicious. We got the fried fish, pad see ew, fried rice, wings and papaya salad. Everything was super tasty. Our server was Kay and she was very nice.We recommend you try this restaurant.
The food was very authentic and the service was excellent! Thank you ka
Lovely experience Kay was a wonderful server and the food was really authentic

I usually get the kana Moo krob . Itâ€™s so delicious ğŸ˜‹ highly recommended trying . Kate is usually here when I come in and she always so nice and efficient. I work around the corner and this is my new spot .
We just came in for a few drinks, appetisers and soups. Very nice food indeed. In a great location, friendly staff, thanks guys

Visiting Brooklyn, stumbled across Elephant District for lunch and were so happy we did! We got some excellent Thai food; our green curry was flavorful and perfectly spicy and the Thai fried rice was delicious! Would recommend the chive cakes, light, crispy, and full of flavor. K was our server and she was very sweet and attentive! Very happy with our experience!
Amanis was super nice !
Amazing!
So delicious ğŸ¥°ğŸ¥°ğŸ¥°
EVERYTHING IS AP GOOD!!! crab fried rice omg
Loved the food and ambience, highly recommended if in Brooklyn!
10/10 pad Thai and Kay was super cool
The most delicious tom kha I had in years! Amanis was great, quick and attentive! Thank you, will definitely come back.
Great food and service! amazing service by K - she gave us the perfect recommendations!
We had a great dinner tonight. Our waitress Kay was amazing and they were very accommodating !
Amazing food and Kay is great. I will definitely be going back.

The best Thai food I have ever eaten! So much flavor and beautiful presentation. Every single thing Iâ€™ve ordered has been amazing. K was a great server, attentive, and knowledgeable about what would be best for our party.
Food was so delicious. The dishes were so balanced a full of flavor. The massaman curry was amazing!

this place was very nice and the food was so delicious! wanna visit later again

I had such a great experience at Elephant District in Brooklyn. The atmosphere was welcoming and the food was fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented, but what really stood out was the service. Our server, City, made the evening truly memorable. From the moment we sat down, she was warm, attentive, and knowledgeable about the menu, offering recommendations that turned out to be excellent.

City had a great sense of timingâ€”she checked in just enough to make sure we had everything we needed without ever feeling rushed. She anticipated small things before we asked and made the whole dining experience feel easy and enjoyable, especially, with water. That level of care and attention to detail really makes a difference.

Overall, Elephant District delivered on both food and service, and City went above and beyond to make it special. Iâ€™ll definitely be coming back and recommending it to friends.

If you looking for a Thai restaurant in DUMBO the Elephant District is a place to stop by.
It's a quaint restaurant with indoor and outdoor dining area with a bar onsite.
The place is really busy....packed with patrons. So, you may be waiting before seating. We waited less 10 minutes to be seated. The place is well organized.  The waitress Kay is personable,  hard-working and attentive.
We ordered for appetizer
Curry chicken puff and  fried chicken.
Drinks: Thai iced tea, malee,
For entree :
Curry shrimp with white rice
Shrimp with garlic and black pepper,  curry duck with noodles,  and fried rice with prawns, and shrimp (tom yum)
The food was pretty good. I enjoyed my experience.
Next time I will try the Mango Thai iced tea.
Parking is scare....take bus or train.

I had a wonderful experience at the Thai Select booth during the event. The booth was very well presented, with a welcoming atmosphere that immediately caught my attention.

The food was delicious and authentic â€“ flavorful, fresh, and beautifully prepared. Each dish gave a true taste of Thai cuisine, and it was clear that great care was taken with both quality and presentation.

We had a wonderful time at Elephant District! Kay was an excellent server and so funny. We came with smaller appetites than we thought but with the smell of the delicious food and the first few bites of what we ordered, we ordered more. We got the chicken wings, thai curry puffs, a Thai Thea and Lao thong, and two orders of duck khao soi. If I lived in New York, I would eat here every day.

Tried Elephant District the other night and the food was amazing! full of flavor and just the spot. The place itself has such a cool vibe too cozy but still stylish. Petter and Moss were awesome! Super friendly and made the whole night even better. Their pork belly skewers and spring rolls are so delicious.
If youâ€™re craving Thai, definitely check it out! ğŸ˜âœ¨ğŸœ.

I had a wonderful experience at this restaurant. Peter& City were attentive and welcoming from the moment I walked in. The dishes were beautifully presented and tasted amazing, especially the branzino. The ambiance was warm and relaxing, making it a perfect spot for both casual dining and special occasions. Highly recommended!

This is a small Brooklyn Thai restaurant but the food is delicious! We ordered some crab curry and some calamari. The waitress was friendly and got our food out quick. A little later my wife ordered some chicken wings and I got the sticky mango rice for dessert. Price was reasonable and the experience was great. Love the elephant using chopsticks pictures on the wall.

This place serves truly authentic Thai food with wonderful natural flavors. I also loved their non alcoholic cocktails. The only thing to know is that they have just one bathroom, so there might be a short wait.

Long overdue review, but I visited elephant district with my mom a little less than a month ago on a rainy day. We ordered the papaya salad, lobster pad Thai, and mango crepe. Everything was so delicious and the ingredients were so fresh! The pad Thai is the best weâ€™ve ever had before! The service was great too, super nice owner. If we ever are back in Brooklyn, weâ€™ll definitely be coming back for the pad Thai :)

If you happen to be in Brooklyn and you like Thai food, this is the place to go! Whereas all other restaurants close by were packed and with long lines, we arrived to a relaxed, small environment that invites to have a break after a long walk; shortly after we sat down, the place started to get busy, yet we remained chilled and enjoyed our time there. We found it absolutely cute to have a drink in an elephant-shaped mug! The Rumpan that comes in it is a refreshing drink. All the food was tasty and we left with happy and full bellies.

I had an absolutely amazing experience at Elephant District! The food was bursting with flavor and perfectly balanced. Every dish was beautifully presented, making it as delightful to look at as it was to eat. I also tried the Mango Thai Tea, which was simply outstanding â€“ refreshing, creamy, and full of tropical sweetness. On top of that, we were warmly welcomed and wonderfully taken care of by City, who made the whole experience even more special. Highly recommend this place for anyone looking for authentic and delicious Thai cuisine in New York!

Food was awesome! Definitely worth it. I wish a lot of people would eat here so they can buy more space and bigger tables. Otherwise, everything else was perfect. The service was fast and the lady who served us was so funny ğŸ˜‚

From the drinks, appetizers, and entrees to its staff: Best Thai food experience in Brooklyn!

Since we got inside the restaurant, you feel welcomed. The food is fantastic! We finished ALL our food!
If you are around, ask for Peter or Mossâ€¦ they are the absolute best!

This place is one of a kind!! A true hidden gem ğŸ’ The food is excellent!  Took my son here for his birthday ğŸ‚ Traveling from Long Island to Brooklyn (Dumbo to be exact) on a weeknight for a 7:30 reservation was not an easy task. I called the restaurant to let them
know weâ€™d be running late. Spoke to Kay and she put my anxiety to rest by changing our reservation to 8pm. As we walked into the restaurant, we were greeted by a very nice lady who turned out to be Kay. She also ended up being our server. She was so attentive,answered all our questions regarding the menu, made some amazing suggestions. Her easy going ways put us in such a good vibe. She was absolutely delightful. We will definitely be back to have your amazing culinary deliciousness! Thank you again Kay!!!

The food was fantastic! Sitting outside under the sunshine with spicy, flavorful, colorful Thai dishes made for a perfect and memorable meal. Our server Kay was attentive and friendly, enhanced our overall dining experience. Recommend!

The food was absolutely amazing â€” fresh, flavorful, and made with love. From the moment we walked in, we felt right at home. After returning to Brooklyn for my fatherâ€™s funeral, the kindness and warmth here meant more than words can say.

Kâ€™s smile and genuine care truly warmed my heart. Thank you, K, for the comfort, great food, and hospitality during a tough time. Weâ€™ll most definitely be back!

Kay was absolutely amazing !!!!! She made the experience fun and super comfortable. I loved the hospitality and the food OMG it was so good I cleaned the plate ğŸ˜ she even offered to take a pic of us and it came out so nice. Iâ€™m so pleased with the experience. Would recommend 100000%

à¸­à¸­ à¸­à¸µà¸à¹€à¸¡à¸™à¸¹à¸‚à¸­à¸‡à¸«à¸§à¸²à¸™ à¸‚à¹‰à¸²à¸§à¹€à¸«à¸™à¸µà¸¢à¸§à¸¡à¸°à¸¡à¹ˆà¸§à¸‡ à¸­à¸£à¹ˆà¸­à¸¢à¸¡à¸²à¸à¸„à¸£à¸±à¸š à¸‚à¸­à¸šà¸„à¸¸à¸“à¸­à¸µà¸à¸„à¸£à¸±à¹‰à¸‡à¸™à¸°à¸„à¸£à¸±à¸š

Dumbo LOVES Elephant District!  This place is adorable, with friendly hardworking staff, lovely cocktails, and delicious dishes.  It's also pretty romantic at night, under the bridge.

When we got in for dinner, it was early, but reservations should definitely happen because people who tried walking in were waiting for a long time to be seated when we got up to leave.  Get a reservation or come early.

Each dish is so tasty!  Genuinely, I'm not certain you could go wrong with any of their dishes because every one we had was delicious, presented well, and fun.

Overall, this is a lovely restaurant with a fun vibe, a cute bar, a larger dining area inside, and outdoor seating.  Hopefully, these pictures do justice to the dishes and restaurant. The vibe is happy and casual.

My favorite part by Far was the adorable elephant drinks.  So CUTE!

10/10!

This place was happened upon after a late afternoon ferry ride.
The food was great, the Pad Thai was the best Iâ€™ve had in Brooklyn. The drinks were interesting, but I wanted to try something new and I wasnâ€™t disappointed.
We sat outside, the tables arenâ€™t level so we almost lost our food and drinks a few times.
The staff were super friendly and place was quaint and gave a great vibe. I doubt this will be my only visit.

If you are in Brooklyn, the best Thai cuisine is here! Pad Thai Lobster was really good. Pork Belly and Mango Sticky Rice so authentic. City aside from being pretty sheâ€™s so friendly and helpful. You should never miss this Thai Resto in NY. â¤ï¸â¤ï¸â¤ï¸

The Elephant District is a cute spot that you MUST go to if youâ€™re in the Dumbo area. The service is absolutely great - our server Kay was very kind and attentive, checking on us regularly and talking to us. We loved the entire experience and the decor!! Service is very fast too!! Will be coming back for more comfort Thai food

Also highly suggest their mango Thai tea ğŸ¥­ğŸ‡¹ğŸ‡­

I came here with 4 companions. I got the mango sticky rice and chicken dumplings. The mango sticky rice was blue which was interesting. Overall the food tasted good but was very overpriced for the small portion sizes and wasnâ€™t anything special.

Authentic Thai Flavors & Sweet Service â€” A Must Try at the heart of NYC, the Elephant District!

Tucked away in the heart of New York, this Thai restaurant is an absolute gem. The food is bold, fresh, and full of authentic flavor but what truly sealed the deal for us was the unforgettable mango sticky rice.

The mango was perfectly ripe and fragrant, paired with soft, slightly chewy sticky rice and that rich, velvety coconut cream that hits all the right notes! Itâ€™s the kind of dessert that makes you close your eyes and savor every bite. Easily one of the best mango sticky rice dishes weâ€™ve had in the city.

The entire experience was made even better thanks to Peter and Sity, who took such great care of us. They were warm, attentive, and made us feel right at home from the moment we sat down. Their genuine hospitality really elevated the whole meal.

If youâ€™re looking for a Thai spot in NYC that serves both incredible food and heartfelt service, this is it. Donâ€™t leave without trying the mango sticky rice and definitely ask for Peter and Sity. ğŸ’•ğŸ’•

Tried the coconut curry noodle with duck(khao soi ped, $27), crispy pork belly rice(krapow moo krob, $26 with egg) and mango thai tea ($12).
Food was nice, but not particularly special. Maybe I had too much expectation. Also I felt it was a little overpriced for what you get (portions were a little small).

Nice location with an interesting interior with a lot of AI generated images (and even on their printed menu where a person had 6 fingers lol).

Kay was our server and she was amazing and very  attentive! She helped me out with suggestions and worked around my allergies (peanuts, tree nuts and soy). The food was really great I got the Khanom Jeen Pu and my friend got the Krapow Moo Krob. Both if cleared out plates. The drinks were also really good! I got the Wan Thong (which is like a lychee martini) which has butterfly pea flower ğŸ˜. My friend got the Lao Thong which he also enjoyed! Definitely come and check them out! Totally worth it!

Can see why this spot got top reviews. The whole place really went with the AI dumbo theme. The food was delicious and came out quickly. Chive sticks crispy outside gooey in not too oily. Pork belly taaty as was the seafood curry. Crab fried rice and duck curry hit the spot. A great experience in the area.

Our visit to Elephant District was a highlight of our trip to NYC! The staff were so kind and friendly, and the food was wonderful. It is located in a great spot in Dumbo as well. I enjoyed the chicken pad Thai and a Thai tea, and both were amazing. We also enjoyed a homemade mango dessert, which was absolutely delicious! Overall, I would recommend Elephant District to anyone looking for some good Thai food in Brooklyn.

My family had a wonderful lunch at Elephant District. We ordered the Bangkok Night Market Wings, Lobster Pad Thai, Kana Moo Krob (with the fried egg), Khao Pad Pu, Pad Kee-Mao with beef, Mango Sticky Rice, and Thai Iced Tea.
The food was phenomenal! The wings were crispy and cooked to perfection. The presentation of the Lobster Pad Thai was incredible (just look at the photo),The Pad Thai was saucy with a huge whole lobster on top. The Kana Moo Krob was a succulent pork belly dish in a sauce we would have drank with a straw. The crab meat fried rice (Khao Pad Pu) was full of sweet crab and very filling. The Pad Kee-Mao was a great spicy noodle dish, with an addictive heat. Despite being full, we couldnâ€™t leave without sampling the mango sticky rice (and a Thai iced tea) and weâ€™re glad we did because it was the icing on top of a great meal.
Overall the impeccable service (hi, Kay!), amazing food, and reasonable prices will have us trekking back across the bridge from the Bronx to visit again.

My friend and I stopped in here after spending some time in Brooklyn and it was fantastic. We had to wait for a bit but were sat surprisingly quickly considering how busy it was. Definitely make a reservation if you plan on dining here.
Kay was amazing! She helped us pick amazing options on the menu. She made our drinks absolutely incredible. We will definitely be coming back here.

This is such a great casual dinner spot in dumbo! The food is genuine Thai food with and emphasis on seafood and street food. We ordered the pork belly dish with a pad see ew and lived both. Very authentic flavours and good portion sizes :)

This is a hard review to write. Love Thai food and was excited to order from this place given the glowing reviews, but the experience was incredibly underwhelming. Itâ€™s possible that the takeout (delivery) experience is completely different from the in-person dining experience, so I put that forth as a disclaimer.

Ordered two Thai iced teas and a duck pad Thai (around 6:30pm) and the food took a little over an hour to be prepared and wasnâ€™t delivered until a little after 8pm. Lovely service and great food. The seating at certain tables might be a bit cramped. They have some unique dishes that you may not find everywhere else. Highly recommend the steamed/ baked fish in banana leaf, Hormok Pla. They had a very nice mango Thai iced tea too, although it may be seasonal. We also had a very well prepared mock duck Thai basil fried rice. It is a good Thai place for vegetarians. Being right next to Dumbo, it is conveniently situated for dining after a sunset walk along the waters.
